title: Scientists work to save sea lions on Kangaroo Island I ABC NEWS
description: South Australia's harmful algal bloom is being partly blamed for a significant spike in Australian sea lion pup deaths. The state government says 84 dead pups were recently recorded on the Pages Islands. Scientists are working to bolster the resilience of the endangered species as the threat of bird flu also approaches. title: Java Man: Indonesia welcomes repatriation of ancient human fossils | The World | ABC NEWS
description: A museum in The Netherlands has returned a set of ancient human fossils known as 'Java Man' to Indonesia, where the remains were originally found more than 100 years ago. The move is being celebrated by historians and advocates, who say the fossils were removed "against the will of the people" during Dutch rule in Indonesia. The World's Girish Sawlani spoke to Indira Estiyanti Nurjadin, Head of the Indonesian Heritage Agency, about the importance of the repatriation. title: Venezuela denounces Trump's order for ship blockade as 'warmongering threats' | The World | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has ordered a blockade on sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela in what he's called a response to drug smuggling and human trafficking. The Venezuelan government has labelled the move as "warmongering threats". Brian Fonseca from the Department of Politics and International Relations at Florida International University, tells The World the US is capable of implementing a blockade of this magnitude. title: The program helping creatives experience Antarctica | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian Antarctic Arts Fellowship gives creatives the chance to travel south and develop works on the icy continent.  The program has been running since 1984, with bird photographer Leila Jeffreys and moving image artist Polly Stanton the latest to embark on the creative journey. title: Classified ADF operation to deliver retired Australian tanks to Ukraine | ABC NEWS
description: ABC’s Europe Bureau Chief Mazoe Ford has been given special access inside the classified operation to deliver retired Australian tanks to Ukraine. The M1A1 Abrams tanks are vulnerable to attack by Russian drones, but Ukraine insists they will make a difference as Moscow’s forces continue to attack. title: Is Bondi the start of a new era of terror? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: What actually works to prevent terrorist attacks and is Australia up to challenge in a complex threat environment?   The Prime Minister says new laws to tackle antisemitism will include powers to deport so-called hate preachers and a new criminal charge for those advocating "racial supremacy".   He’s also been pressured into adopting in-full the recommendations from the Special Envoy's Plan to Combat Antisemitism.   Today, the Lowy Institute's Lydia Khalil on how to stop the next terror attack.   Featured:    Lydia Khalil, extremism and counter terrorism expert and the director of the transnational challenges program at the Lowy Institute

title: Caravan park residents in Tasmania to get increased protections | ABC NEWS
description: Residents of caravan parks in Tasmania who own their own homes would be provided with increased protections under draft legislation released by the state government today.   The draft legislation prohibits no-grounds evictions of those on long-term leases, and limits rent increases to every 12 months.
